nav.div: Spencerport Central School District » District » Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) » Access for Students & Instruction Section » K-5 At Home Learning

span.span: This web page has been created to communicate At-Home Learning plans and provide resources for students in grades K-5. Use the sub-pages to the left to find the appropriate grade level resources for your child.

span.style: margin: 0px; padding: 0px; user-select: text; -webkit-user-drag: none; -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent; line-height: 19.275px; font-family: Calibri, Calibri_EmbeddedFont, Calibri_MSFontService, sans-serif;
background-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; font-family: Tahoma;

span.span: Please know the health and well-being of our students and their families are our first priority in these unprecedented times. The intent of the calendars for weekly work is to keep students engaged in learning during the school closure. It is not mean

span.style: background-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; font-family: Tahoma;
background-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; font-family: Tahoma;

span.span: to overwhelm families; we hope that these learning opportunities provide students with a sense of normalcy and connection to school.

span.style: font-weight: bold; background-color: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; font-family: Tahoma;

span.span: Engage with the resources the best you can and please reach out to your child’s teacher or principal if you have any questions.

br.br:
To provide additional support to students during this time, we've included a series of Social Emotional Learning Activities you can do with your family. Click the link below to access.
SEL Ideas at home.pdf

span.br: If you are looking for additional learning opportunities for your child beyond what is outlined in the calendars, we encourage students to access the District's Intranet homepage. There are a variety of resources from which your child can choose. You can access the Intranet by following the directions below.

br.span: Additionally, our K-5 Librarians have put together a fantastic resource for accessing digital reading material, read alouds, websites, and programs for our Elementary Students. Click HERE to access.

Students and parents who need assistance with technology should call the Tech. Help Desk at 349-5106 between the hours of 8 a.m. and 3 p.m. A member of our Computer Services Team will be able to offer their assistance.

br.br: Based on the Governor's most recent executive orders, we have created weekly calendars for each grade level for the weeks of April 20th and 27th. You will be able to find your child's calendar and supporting resources in sub-pages to the left; they will be posted by the end of the day on April 17th. The calendars may contain links to digital resources; if you are directed to the Intranet Homepage to use a program, please follow the directions above for your child to login to the District Intranet Page.
